author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1533840271}
review:
"Hit Tank PRO" ist ein kleiner, schneller Casual Top-Down-Shooter.

Eine Story gibt es erst gar nicht, braucht es bei dem Genre aber auch nicht. Wichtig sind die Mechaniken. Und die sind sehr simpel und haben mit einem Panzer so gut wie gar nichts zu tun.

Denn im Gegensatz zur Realität fährt unser Panzer superschnell, stopt sofort und fährt auch sofort rückwärts. Unsere Geschosse sind auch erstaunlich, denn sie prallen wie Billardkugeln von Wänden nach dem Prinzip Einfalls- gleich Ausfallswinkel ab.

Jeder der sechszig Level ist ein einziger Screen, der meist durch ein paar Wände, durch die man nicht schießen kann, eingeteilt ist. In dem Level befinden sich mehrere Gegner, die wir möglichst rasch ausschalten müssen. Ein Level dauert in der Regel nur wenige Sekunden. 

So ein Casual-Spielchen ohne Tiefgang kann durchaus einige Zeit Spaß machen und mechanisch funktioniert das Spielchen grundsätzlich auch. Zudem kann man von Anfang an sämtliche Level anwählen und einiges einstellen: Die eigene Geschwindigkeit, die Hitboxgröße und den Schwierigkeitsgrad.

Und doch kommt rasch Langeweile auf. Das liegt nicht an den vorhandenen technischen Schwächen wie etwa, daß es eigentlich nur in einem Fenster läuft und man es gar nicht richtig auf Bildschirmgröße hochskaliert bekommt. Auch daß Grafik und Soud eher schwach sind, wär für das Genre kein Problem. Ein Problem ist vielmehr das repetetive und dadurch wenig befriedigende Gameplay das trotz ganz netter und auch einigermaßen abwechslungsreicher Level nicht wirklich länger zu fesseln vermag.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
4/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
5/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
5/10 Spielmechanik
4/10 Balancing
5/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Kein Hit, der Tank.

[h1][b]5/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198073342553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1467468261}
review:
[ENG] 
A good arcade casual game with 60 levels each one with a different strategy. If you have time to waste something like half an hour that's the way. Those 60 levels can be faced in three different ways. One by one selecting the different parameters. 20 levels at a time selecting the parameters of those levels and a limited number of lives. The Pro mode, where you will face 20 random levels (1/20 - 21-40 -41/60) of unknown difficult with a limited number of lives.
Recommended when you are bored and it's on sales (something like less of 1€). 
Does not buy it at full price, it doesn't worth the money because it looks like a mix between an old game for a video arcade machine and a free mobile app.
[ITA] 
È un buon arcade da giocare casual quando si una mezzoretta da perdere, ci sono 60 livelli abbastanza diversificati con ognuno la sua strategia. Questi 60 livelli possono essere affrontati in tre modalità diverse: uno alla volta selezionando i vari parametri, a blocchi di 20 potendo selezionare i parametri per quei 20 livelli (ma con un numero limitato di vite per tutti e 20 i livelli) e la modalità pro che ti affida un blocco random di 20 livelli senza scelta dei parametri.
Consigliato per quando siete annoiati e costa meno di 0,90€. 
Non compratelo a prezzo pieno, non ne vale la pena anche perchè sembra un misto fra un vecchio gioco per cabinato e un'app free da smartphone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1500925071}
review:
[h1]Hit Tank PRO est ce qu’on appelle un jeu de ricochets, enfin, presque[/h1]

Vous aimez les jeux de ricochets, moi, j’adore.

Pour ceux qui se demandent ce qu’est un jeu de ricochets, c’est un jeu où vous devez tirer contre des parois pour atteindre et éliminer vos ennemis. Hit Tank PRO n’est pas un vrai jeu de ricochets puisque les obus ne rebondissent qu’une fois !

A travers les 60 niveaux du jeu, vous devez éliminer les adversaires, ça peut être d’autres tanks mais aussi des tourelles.

L’histoire, il n’y en a pas. C’est triste car le jeu se prête bien à une histoire. Vous avez juste des niveaux accessibles de manière non linéaire.

Le jeu est un ce qu’on appelle (sans aucune intention péjorative) un petit jeu et vous permet de vous occuper de nombreuses heures et tout ça pour un prix très petit. Ne vous le refusez pas !

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/05/21/test-hit-tank-pro-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour découvrir une description plus complète du jeu et quelques prises écran de Hit Tank PRO, allez sur mon site.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019169430', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1465567687}
review:
Ce jeu est loin d'être parfait. Les menus et la fenêtre ne donnent pas la sensation que l'on joue à un jeu terminé.
Il existe de bien meilleurs jeux du même style gratuitement et en flash sur internet, je ne vois pas pourquoi qui que ce soit devrait payer 3€ pour un tel jeu. 
Il y a quand même eu quelques efforts, mais ce n'est juste pas assez: les graphismes ne sont que des tilemaps, la musique est ok mais très discrète, le level design pas très innovant.
Si vous aimez ce genre de jeux, je vous recommande 'Endless War 3' (ou la franchise en général), disponible gratuitement en ligne, un jeu similaire sorti bien des années avant, mais toujours plus agréable à jouer que 'Hit Tank Pro'.

review:
Simple and entertaining game of action and strategy where basically you move tanks and open fire to survive. The best thing is that the game has a variety of maps and the difficulty which you can choose to taste without stalling a long time in it. As you progress more interesting it is and depending on how you move some obstacles can play against or in favor. Very useful to use the walls to bounce your shots and thus evade enemy fire if you want to not be very exposed because the enemy anticipates your moves.

 The best of the shots is that you can spam infinite missiles. If you win well but if you lose experience a feeling of revenge or something like that, it creates addiction. The controls can be changed if you want. No experienced errors or glitches that prevented play, all very fluid and simple. I really enjoyed the game even to play it sporadically any time. If you like simple games of move and shoot would you recommend this.

review:
This game has a clunky interface, there's no story, the soundtrack is repetitive but, for what it is, it's actually okay.
It could be a flash game, certainly, so I think it's a bit pricey, but if you can get it on sale or at a giveaway such as the one orlygift did a while ago, it's most certainly worth it. Keep in mind, though, that if you're not "just another casual player", you won't enjoy this at all. There are no extra features such as achievements nor trading cards; it's just a casual game to pass some time on. It works, basically. I'd give it a 2 out of 5. There's a lot of room for improvement, but it's still mildly enjoyable as it is. I'd rather play something else if I had to choose, quite frankly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044149845', 'num_games_owned': 2154, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1472596280}
review:
[h1][b][u]Hit Tank PRO Review - Rating: 7.2/10[/u][/b][/h1]

[h1][b]General Impression[/b][/h1]
[quote]Hit Tank PRO is an alright combination of the action, casual, indie and strategy genres. The graphics are relatively nice, being neat, with decent textures. The atmosphere varies between different 40 different maps, which have obstacles and some tunnels which don’t allow you to see your friendly tank (when you go through it), the enemy tanks (when they go through it), or the shells. The audio is alright. The music is pretty nice, even though a single soundtrack seems repetitive, it’s well-chosen for this type of game. The gameplay is basically reaching the final point of the map. On your way, you must destroy the enemy tanks, as well as defend yourself from the up-coming shells, and from the turrets shooting as well. There are 4 difficulties available, which will decide the number of lives you have at your disposal. The user interface is well-optimized, with no bugs and well-synthetized information. The engines are alright, I haven’t met any bugs, crashes, screen freezes or frame drops. The mechanics are pretty solid, I haven’t any glitches around them. Overall, it’s a pretty cute game, with relatively nice graphics and many levels to combat, turning harder and harder as you progress throughout the game.[/quote] 

[h1][b]Positive Points[/b][/h1]
[quote][list][*]Pretty decent graphics
[*]Decent sounds
[*]Challenging gameplay
[*]Very diversified maps
[*]Three mode challenges
[*]Many difficulties to choose from
[*]Many obstacles around the maps
[*]Many skins for enemy tanks[/list][/quote]

[h1][b]Neutral Points[/b][/h1]
[quote][list][*]Probably adding some other enemies than tanks and turrets would improve the gameplay
[*]The game only has 1 soundtrack, which will become boring sooner or later
[*]It would have been even nicer with multiplayer[/list][/quote]

[h1][b]Negative Points[/b][/h1]
[quote][list][*]The instructions are pretty unclear
[*]After level 30-40 the game gets very hard,  this should be fixed by reducing the amount of enemies or by making the friendly tank stronger and being able to send more damage
[*]The game only has 1 soundtrack, which will become boring sooner or later[/list][/quote]

review: It's exactly like one of those bad flash games we used to play as children. review:
Um joguinho de Tanks simples que, a princípio, pareceu-me ser como aqueles clássicos de DOS ou Atari, como Battle City, mas na verdade tem um foco mais em puzzle, do que em eliminar todos os inimigos, Os gráficos são agradáveis, o desafio vai se elevando aos poucos e permite se escolher a dificuldade de cada desafio, o que é bom; a música e os efeitos são simples, mas condizentes com o game. Contudo, é mais um jogo pensado para plataformas móveis, algo mais casual e descompromissado. Algo que seria bem-vindo, seria um editor de fases e batlhas mano-a-mano.
Vale a pena se você gostar de games casuais com bons níveis de desafio e estiver numa boa promoção!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982504799', 'num_games_owned': 4252, 'num_reviews': 2873, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1450360276}
review:
Hit Tank PRO - посредственная аркада.

В аннотации игры сказано что это "захватывающая игра", как по мне она захватывает так же как набор объявлений в бесплатной газете. Графически игра рядится в старые, знакомые еще по дэнди "танчики", и то умудряется выглядеть мрачно, серо и некрасиво. По геймплею же - у нас в стране есть такой странный вид спорта: танковый биатлон, так вот, автор игры решил пойти своим путем и сделал какую-то вариацию танкового пин-понга. Снаряды отскакивают от стен как мячики, и нам вот таким вот образом нужно расчитывать траекторию попадания нашего снаряда во вражину, и уклонение от снарядов этой вражины, и все это на время. Ни сюжета, ни кампании в игре нет, только набор миссий, и возможность настроить отдельные параметры: кол-во врагов, время матча и т.д.

Игра может и имела бы какой-то потенциал, но только если бы была возможность игры по сети.
В одиночном же режиме игра скучна и безрадостна.
2 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169373538', 'num_games_owned': 2107, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1450301963}
review:
Que decir de este juego, tienes un tanque y hay otros tanques, dispara unos misiles que pueden rebotar una vez en paredes y obstáculos y dales a todos los otros tanques antes de que te den a ti, así en todas las misiones.
Todas las "misiones" están desbloqueadas desde el principio, así que si quieres puedes jugar la última si lo deseas (la cual me pase a la primera, que crack soy).
Otra de las cosas divertidas es que en cada misión me cambiaban los controles, igual en una controlabas el tanque con W,A,S,D que en la siguiente lo controlabas con los cursores de movimiento, cada fase una sorpresa que te mantendrá atado a la silla.
En resumen si quieres pasar un rato disparando a tanques sin tener que estrujarte mucho los sesos es un juego entretenido para pasar el rato.
(Además no puedes argumentar que no sabías lo que te estabas comprando ya que encima te dan una demo para que lo pruebes antes de comprarlo, todo un detalle que no tienen otros).

review:
Hit Tank Pro is a hard one to review, because if you put aside the fact that it feels unfinished, the art isn't the most beautiful and the controls aren't perfect, if you can get past that you can actually have some fun with this game.

It feels a lot like the old NES title 'Battle City', I haven't seen anything else like this in the store, so if you like that one and are looking for something similar you might enjoy this one too, because if it was literally incomplete, it would be a pretty decent game as the core mechanics are quite fun, but in it's current and possibly final state I just can't recommend it.

review:
(NOTE: This game was reviewed using a key provided by the Developer and/or Publisher)

Video Review

https://youtu.be/yyh1AdlB-bY

The "Too Long, Didn't Watch" Review:

For $3 it really is fun. Reminds me of Combat for my old Atari 2600. 3/5, controls can be an issue.

The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:

 Great throwback! Are there limitations, yes. There are. So, I'll cover those first. Controls are an issue and you will be resetting these between levels IF you do the missions one at a time, during the "Challenge" mode this is not a problem (except setting them initially for each run). The interface is a tad clunky, but you get used to it really quickly. The music is also good, but after hearing the same track between each round it can get hold. This is not a reflection of it's quality at all though, I actually liked it. It simply got repetitive. That is it though, for the limitations. The actual positives in this game were far more numerous than I originally expected. It allows for some nice customization (difficulty, hitbox size, etc) that can increase/decrease difficulty as desired. There are three game modes, one of which allows you to essentially practice on any level you choose. The Online Leaderboards make this one to run and stack High Scores up with your friends. All in all, for $3 this is actually a nice little gem. A great little casual game to pass the time and as you get hooked, there are aspects to keep you playing. Fans of Speed Runs or achieving High Scores are going to want to be all over this one. No achievements or cards, so steer clear if that's all you want. Good fun to be had here on the cheap.
3/5 and would definitely recommend at this price!

Happy Gaming!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1473787612}
review:
Hit Tank PRO reminds of an old game, whose name I can't remember, where you're a tank pitched against others. You have the same core mechanics here. And thanks to Bechstein, I found the name: Battle City.

You're directing a tank through different levels and your goal is to destroy every enemy present. Some of them are stationary and slow to fire, while others are moving and sending many rockets towards you. You get hit? You're trying the level again with all enemies spawning again. Depending on the difficulty, you will have less lives to do.

8 minutes is short to write a review. However, when you've played some levels, you know already how the game will be. The graphics are correct and the soundtrack is just a jingle and tanks sounds.

The game is itself a nice little one when you want to take a little break. However, my main problem is the menu in the Missions mode. Indeed, while it's great to have included the three different types of moving (arrows, WASD and ZQSD), while it's great to choose for each level your difficulty, some options, your speed or the hit box, the problem is that when you're pointing your cursor on the keys options, speed or hitbox, you can change the options you have set. And when you're think that ZQSD is chosen and that in reality, you have the arrows.... I mean, it would be great that at least, the choice of ZQSD, WASD or arrows is on another menu and not on the one where you're setting your preferences for the level. Also, when you finish a level, instead of advancing to the next one, you're sent back to the menu (which is normal if you want to change the difficulty or anything else) and if you don't click yourself on "Next", you're going to play the level you've beaten again.

However, the Mode Pro/Challenge is changing that way: you set your configuration, your number of life (Pro), level and difficulty and you'll be passing from a level to another without being sent to the menu.

Because of the menu in Missions, I'm not quite satisfied - it should have a description of each mode - I would have gone directly to the Mode Pro instead of Missions. In itself, it's a good challenging game though. And here's a challenge: if you're on orly, you can write a review of 50 characters instead of copy/pasting official description or reviews from others. If you can't do it but resort to copy/paste what isn't your work, I've been on a rampage to report you. I'm not taking my time to share my experience with others for your greed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1449492589}
review:
[h1]This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.[/h1]

Hit Tank PRO is a challenge mode based action strategy game, releasing on December 2nd 2015, by a single developer Bacq Stellan. 

Gameplay in Hit Tank PRO is set in a birds eye view of a small simple map, where you are in control of a single tank, and you have to destroy varying numbers of enemy tanks. Each of the maps are set out differently, some come with mazes, some have destructible objects,  whilst others have a fog of war mechanic, leaving you in the lurch as to what you can see.  Whilst the gameplay is very simple, it comes with a very addictive nature to it, and the higher levels can get really fast paced and hectic as the levels progressively get harder and more enemies that you have to deal with. I would really liked to have seen some sort of levelling process for your tank, or some sort of customizability, maybe to upgrade weapons or your armour, but the only sort of customizing you get, is changing the speed of your tank at the start of the game. You can obviously make your tank the fastest, but this will in turn give your score a handicap compared to if you didn’t make your tank faster. There are 60 levels in this game too, so quite a stack of levels to go at.  

Graphics are very basic, the top down view helps it a little here, but honestly the graphics are nothing to shout about. I was a little let down by the sprites of the tanks and the overall aesthetic of the game, it would have been nice to get some better looking maps to fight in. The sound effects are OK, however the music is weird…it sounds a bit like Wild West music, but in tanks? I don’t quite know how to explain it, something just didn’t sound right about the music in Hit Tank PRO. 

There are a varying amount of difficulties here, there are four difficulty settings, Easy, Normal, Medium (aren’t they the same?) and hard.  Onto of these difficulty settings, you can also make the game harder or easier by changing the bullet speed, your hitbox size, and of course, your tank’s speed. This adds another layer of difficulty settings, allowing you to tweak how hard (or easy) the game is for you. 

I have been playing on Normal difficulty for about half an hour now, and I have managed to clear all sixty levels, that to me show that whilst there are a lot of levels, there isn’t anything really challenging unless you ramp up the difficulty settings to a higher level. You could probably get three or four hours of more content out of the game with varying levels of difficulty, but that’s about it. 

I sadly had a few annoying technical issues, one is that the game doesn’t use any direct x engine, so I was unable to capture any footage using Fraps. Secondly (and the most annoying) is the game doesn’t lock your cursor in its window, this is only really an issue for anyone with more than one screen – you’ll often find your cursor has wandered across to your other screens, you’ll click and the game minimizes, this is an infuriating bug which almost always results in you dying. The third and probably the biggest big, is a game breaking one unfortunately. Some levels you’ll end up clearing all of the tanks you can see, and the game will insist that there is one tank left alive, when there quite clearly isn’t. This is even more prominent on the levels past stage 50. You can’t even kill yourself by shooting a rocket into yourself, the game just breaks, you actually have to quit the game in order for it to work again, and obviously this loses your scores. 

To sum up, I really like the premise behind the gameplay of this game, but sadly in its current state it isn’t going to be recommended. I am not going to lie; I did actually have fun in the game, when it worked. I think the game can improve a lot on the graphical front, and include some customizability in to make completing the levels feel more like an accomplishment. I personally think that this game would really benefit from a local or online multiplayer mode as I can see that being a ton of fun too. Most of all, the bugs and glitches need to be cleaned up ASAP.  The game is priced at £1, 99 when not on sale, and there is also a demo to try out too if you are still interested in trying it out.

1) Stay away
[b][u]2) Not Recommended[/u][/b]
3) Only recommended when on sale
4) Recommended
5) Highly recommended
6) This is a must play
